On categorical ticks: It seems that categorical ticks broke with the `Figure` update, because the keywords in `PlotSpec(points, tickranges = xyrange, ticklabels = labels)`  don’t get forwarded to the axis. Is that correct?

Assuming that this will take some time to be fixed, I would like to have a robust way to fix the ticks manually.

Right now the positions are determined by mapping `unique(categorical_x)` to `1:length(unique(categorical_x))`. So you can’t really change the order.

What do you think about using DataAPI.jl instead? Something like

```categorical_labels(xs)       = DataAPI.levels(xs)
categorical_range(xs)        = values(DataAPI.refpool(xs))
categorical_position(xs, x)  = DataAPI.invrefpool(xs)[x]```
One could add a third category to the categorical trait
```# Trait for categorical values
struct Categorical end
struct HasRefPool end # the better Categorical
struct Continous end

categorical_trait(::Type, x) = !isnothing(refpool(x)) ? HasRefPool() : Categorical()```
What do you think?

I might work on a PR when I feel like procrastinating the next time.
